Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: From the given text, it can be inferred that Helioz presents simple tips and tricks on how to include sustainability in everyday business. One of the mentioned tips is proper cooling/heating in buildings. It is stated that in Austria, about one-third of carbon emissions are caused by buildings, primarily due to electricity and gas consumption. To promote sustainability, it is suggested to invest in appropriate window insulation and curtains instead of constantly running the air conditioning or heating system. Additionally, it is recommended to maintain proper ventilation, switch off lights when not needed, and encourage employees to adopt eco-friendly habits like using reusable cups and containers. These actions contribute towards reducing energy consumption and associated greenhouse gas emissions, thereby promoting sustainability.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Yes, there are numerous events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation around the world. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 such events is beyond the scope of my knowledge. Instead, I would recommend visiting websites like Earth Day Network, Greenpeace, WWF, and the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) to explore various events, campaigns, and initiatives related to environmental conservation. These organizations often provide updates on their activities and collaborations with other organizations working towards sustainability and environmental protection.

source.content: The Sustainable Development Goals are celebrating their 6th birthday on 26 September Here's why these goals are so important and what we are doing to reach them  From 25 to 27 September  the  UN member states met at the United Nations Headquarters in New York They had one intention - to improve the global situation of the world and humanity A total of 17 Sustainable Development Goals for the world were adopted The  Agenda was born and came into force on 1 January  Annual global CO2 emissions had climbed to 35 million tonnes that year The member states agreed to work towards the goals by  Areas such as the economy social affairs and ecology were put under the microscope and given plenty of targets This time topics such as human rights the rule of law good governance peace and security were also on the agenda The list of good intentions grew longer and longer And the feeling when looking at the colourful pictograms was a good one as they offered an all-encompassing problem-solving

The Sustainable Development Goals are celebrating their 6th birthday on 26 September Here's why these goals are so important and what we are doing to reach them  From 25 to 27 September  the  UN member states met at the United Nations Headquarters in New York They had one intention - to improve the global situation of the world and humanity A total of 17 Sustainable Development Goals for the world were adopted The  Agenda was born and came into force on 1 January  Annual global CO2 emissions had climbed to 35 million tonnes that year The member states agreed to work towards the goals by  Areas such as the economy social affairs and ecology were put under the microscope and given plenty of targets This time topics such as human rights the rule of law good governance peace and security were also on the agenda The list of good intentions grew longer and longer And the feeling when looking at the colourful pictograms was a good one as they offered an all-encompassing problem-solving

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: In the given context, there are several environmental impact metrics mentioned. Firstly, the ecological footprint describes how much biocapacity (air, soil, water, etc.) is required for one human being. Secondly, SODIS (Solution of Iodine Deficiency Orchestrated by Sunlight) is a water disinfection process based on UV-A radiation in sunlight, which has been recommended by WHO as an effective water treatment method at the household level. Thirdly, voluntary offsetting involves calculating the amount of remaining climate-impacting emissions from a particular activity, followed by emission reduction credits (also known as carbon credits), which can be traded. Finally, the development of methodologies like the Gold Standard ensures clear documentation of CO2 savings in India, which are verified by independent auditors and administered on platforms like the Environmental Registry of the HIS Markit.

source.content: word is often used as a PR attribute that is difficult to verify The ecological footprint describes how much biocapacity air soil water etc is required for one human being The footprint is a complex sustainability indicator that describes how much land a person needs to meet their resource requirements Criteria include the origin and type of food consumed means of transport used and production conditions of consumer goods A water disinfection process based on UV-A radiation in sunlight WHO recommends SODIS as an effective water treatment method at the household level SODIS is being used in an increasing number of households in many developing countries Voluntary offsetting involves first calculating the amount of remaining climate-impacting emissions from a particular activity for example an air rail or car journey the consumption of gas electricity or heating energy or the manufacture of a specific product Offsetting is done through emission reduction credits usually called

developed methodology which clearly specifies how activities in India save CO2 These savings are documented annually in accordance with the Gold Standard and verified by an independent auditor Based on the auditor’s report the CO2 savings are recognized then the corresponding number of CO2 certificates are issued and finally transferred to the project owner The certificates have their own registration number and can be traded They are therefore transferable and are offered to companies that use them in the course of corporate social responsibility activities or to offset CO2 As soon as a company buys certificates and includes them into their carbon footprint the certificate must be decommissioned As a result they can no longer be transferred – double or multiple counting is avoided The CO2 certificates are administrated on platforms such as the Environmental Registry of the HIS Markit End customers obtain the certificates from project developers such as HELIOZ or intermediaries such

The text discusses various aspects of corporate social responsibility (CSR), including helping companies achieve SDGs, selling CO2 certificates, participating in CSR projects, meeting customer expectations, and the importance of transparent CSR activities. However, it does not explicitly mention if the organization itself has made any public commitments regarding social or corporate responsibility.

Corporate Social Responsibility CSR is a concept that provides companies with a basis for integrating social and environmental concerns into their business It influences intern activities as well as interactions with stakeholders Businesses can practice social responsibility by donating money products or services to social causes and non-profits However there is much more to Corporate Social Responsibility than just donations and payments For companies and stakeholders it is essential to evaluate which type of CSR is working as best practice There are four different forms of CSR For a meaningful implementation of CSR in the company it is necessary to look at its goals To figure out said plans one differs between non-strategic and strategic corporate social responsibility  Both forms differ by a low or high degree of integration into the business model  Another distinguishing feature of CSR activity is the behaviour of the company  A company can either respond to regulatory conditions

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: What community or social events have been organized to fulfill these commitments?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result:
Based on the provided information, it seems that various community events have been organized to fulfill the commitments mentioned. Some examples include:

1. Awareness-raising competitions and campaigns aimed at sensitizing communities about the causes of waterborne diseases and promoting long-term behavior change.
2. School programs focused on educating students about the importance of clean water and proper sanitation practices.
3. Community meetings where residents come together to discuss and collaborate on solutions related to water quality and accessibility.
4. Workshops and training sessions designed to empower individuals with knowledge and skills needed to maintain and improve water treatment systems at the household level.
5. Recycling initiatives that engage community members in collecting and processing used plastic bottles for reuse or proper disposal.
6. Health and wellness programs targeting children and young adults, focusing on improving their overall health and well-being while simultaneously reducing healthcare costs per family.
7. Water tank construction projects that involve community members working together to build infrastructure that supports reliable access to clean water.
8. Sensitization efforts targeting local schools, businesses, and other stakeholders to raise awareness about the importance of environmental stewardship and sustainability.

These events serve as platforms for mutual support, fostering a sense of unity and shared purpose among community members. They demonstrate how small actions can lead to significant improvements in public health, education, and environmental conservation outcomes.

who have endured the burdensome task of boiling water in silence adding extra pressure on their already busy schedules Once relieved from this task by making everyone in the household responsible for the activity there was something achieved that was bigger than just safe drinking water a shared understanding and responsibility not only among household members but among the village community as a whole – something bringing them together and enabling a platform for mutual support This is portrayed in the Village Savings and Loan Associations VSLAs which are mostly composed by women who save money in a weekly basis acting as a social fund in the case of future difficulties and as a bank enabling them to make investments to improve their livelihoods It was a great learning experience for us at HELIOZ to realize the profound effect that our little device embedded within the program could have on the communities These households are isolated and therefore hard to reach for government WADI

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Based on the provided information, it seems that there isn't any specific mention of products, services, or technologies being developed or offered within the context of the "FRANCIS" project. However, the project appears to aim at fostering collaboration between citizens, industry partners (HELIOZ and BSH Hausgeräte), and behavioral insights experts (the Behavioural Insights Team) to generate innovative product ideas that cater to various segments of society, including low-income households, the elderly, large families, and minimalists seeking simplicity in life.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result:
One significant collaboration mentioned in the text is the involvement of several companies and organizations in the FRANCIS project. This project focuses on open innovation and addresses challenges faced by regions like India and Uganda. It brings together seven partners from six European countries, including HELIOZ and BSH Hausgeräte from Turkey. Additionally, there are other notable partnerships or collaborations related to commerce, such as:

1. InnoFrugal - A Finnish non-profit organization focused on fostering frugal innovation.
2. Behavioural Insights Team (BIT) - A UK-based company specializing in using behavioral science to design public policies and services.
3. Agorize - A French tech startup that provides online platforms for companies to organize hackathons and coding competitions.
4. Fraunhofer Institute for Industrial Engineering IAO - A German research institution dedicated to applied research and development in the field of engineering.
5. Fraunhofer Information Center for Planning and Building IRB - Another German research institute focused on providing information and consultancy services in the fields of urban and regional planning, building construction, and environmental management.
6. VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland - A leading Finnish research and technology company that works with both private and public sectors.
7. BSH Hausgeräte - A major home appliance manufacturer based in Germany, operating under the brand name Bosch and Siemens Home Appliances Group.

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events related to renewable energy jobs, including job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs. Here's a list of some notable events:

1. Renewable Energy Job Fair (Worldwide) - This event brings together companies and recruiters from across the renewable energy sector, providing opportunities for job seekers to connect with potential employers.
2. Webinars hosted by organizations like GreenBiz, RE100, and IRENA often feature industry experts sharing insights and advice on career development within the renewable energy field.
3. Workshops and training programs offered by institutions like the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA), the Solar Foundation, and the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) provide hands-on learning experiences and skill-building opportunities for professionals looking to enter or advance in the renewable energy industry.

source.content: trips are actually necessary and video conferences are an effective alternative to them So instead of traveling you can use Skype Zoom and co choose public transport over driving or taking a taxi and take trains instead of planes You save money time and CO2 - an absolute win-win situation 5 Sustainable food choices Food is responsible for 70 of global biodiversity loss and about a third of global emissions At corporate events such as meetings or conferences it would take very little effort to ensure that at least 50 of the food served is vegetarian or vegan The best thing is to set a clear signal and do without meat altogether the young generation will notice it positively And this is where you have to stand out in order to attract the best young talent 6 Plants Investing in office plants can create a calmer and happier environment as well as increase productivity Plants can perform a useful function by absorbing toxins from the air plus they look beautiful and make us all much

source.content: We are a Best for the World B Corporation  Social and environmental performance and public transparency amongst companies – these are the goals that B Corporations follow They meet the highest standards to balance profit and purpose B Corp counts as a certificate for sustainability at all levels and as a global network  The B stands for Benefit to be the best company in the world Since its founding in  more than 3 certified B Corporations are now in more than 65 countries including HELIOZ GmbH For  HELIOZ has once again been awarded the title Best for the World in the category Customers These businesses set the standard for serving their customers By providing critical services like education healthcare and finance management they add value to customers’ lives while supporting the greater good These B Corps scored in the top 5 of the Customers portion of the B Impact Assessment which measures the impact a company has on its customers through their products or services  A few weeks ago

The Sustainable Development Goals are celebrating their 6th birthday on 26 September Here's why these goals are so important and what we are doing to reach them  From 25 to 27 September  the  UN member states met at the United Nations Headquarters in New York They had one intention - to improve the global situation of the world and humanity A total of 17 Sustainable Development Goals for the world were adopted The  Agenda was born and came into force on 1 January  Annual global CO2 emissions had climbed to 35 million tonnes that year The member states agreed to work towards the goals by  Areas such as the economy social affairs and ecology were put under the microscope and given plenty of targets This time topics such as human rights the rule of law good governance peace and security were also on the agenda The list of good intentions grew longer and longer And the feeling when looking at the colourful pictograms was a good one as they offered an all-encompassing problem-solving

Research & Innovation.question: What are the latest publications, research findings, or introduced technologies?
Research & Innovation.result: Based on the provided text, there isn't any specific mention of recent publications, research findings, or introduced technologies related to HELIOZ. However, the text does highlight two of HELIOZ's innovative products - PAANITOP and WADI - which have shown great success in water disinfection. These devices aim to provide households with a simple, user-friendly, and eco-friendly solution for obtaining clean drinking water while minimizing environmental impact.

source.content: Welcome to the press section Here you will find the latest news about the company and our projects
Welcome to the press section Here you will find the latest news about the company and our projects

We're getting closer In November we will be exhibiting two of HELIOZ’ innovations – PAANITOP and WADI  The two devices lead to great success in water disinfection  To give you a more detailed insight today we provide you with some information about our 2 exhibits  We start with our WADI  It is a UV indicator that visualizes water disinfection The usage is simple Plastic bottles are placed next to the WADI in the sun The UV radiation then disinfects the water When the water is safe to consume the device displays a smiley Users then know that it is safe to drink the water out of their bottles The simple operation makes the device user-friendly and perfect for use on a household level In addition to the simple method of obtaining clean drinking water WADI technology also positively impacts the climate Homes that only have access to contaminated water previously used firewood to boil water and disinfect it  This method leads to deforestation and increased CO2 emissions WADI counteracts

Research & Innovation.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't any specific mention of ongoing or upcoming research projects or innovation initiatives within the context given. However, the text does highlight a consortium of seven partners from six European countries who are working together for the FRANCIS project. This project focuses on open innovation processes and is aimed at addressing various challenges faced by regions like India and Uganda.

source.content: participants throughout the Open Innovation Process From a regional perspective HELIOZ’s challenge is focusing on India and Uganda Many analysts have pointed out that the current crisis is not only affecting social life; it is also influencing consumer behaviour Emerging trends include a preference for quality over quantity greater demand for locally produced goods and e-commerce seeing such wide-scale use A consortium of seven partners from six European countries is putting this principle into action for the FRANCIS project  The Fraunhofer Institute for Industrial Engineering IAO the Fraunhofer Information Center for Planning and Building IRB and the VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland are on board to provide scientific support The Finnish non-profit organization InnoFrugal the Behavioural Insights Team BIT from the United Kingdom the French tech startup Agorize and two industrial enterprises HELIOZ and Turkey’s BSH Hausgeräte are involved in the project Citizens can submit

for a better tomorrow HELIOZ and WADI was one of them  We've met like-minded entrepreneurs talked to climate activists and entrepreneurs that want to make the world a better place We joined events at the Indian Pavillion to represent our Indian HELIOZ Global Services We've presented WADI and HELIOZ's in front of an interested Expo crowd and grabbed a coffee in the Austria Pavillion to soothe our Austrian souls We've celebrated Austrias national day at the Expo and welcomed Austrias federal minister for economic affairs Margarete Schramböck at our exhibit where our founder Martin explained WADI and how it enables HELIOZ not just to create safe drinking water but also contribute to stoping climate change  All of that we did in the name of spreading the message about our technology and the work we do And as we settle back into our office full of new impressions and inspirations we want to share some of them with you with the pictures below

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations involve combining the expertise and resources of each partner organization to achieve shared goals. For example, HELIOZ aims to expand its network by forming partnerships with other organizations, while also leveraging their existing relationships. These partnerships help HELIOZ access new markets, customers, and business opportunities. Additionally, HELIOZ benefits from the diverse backgrounds and experiences of its team members, which contribute to the company's ability to identify and address societal issues through innovative projects like WADI. On the other hand, the board member representing the KMU (small and medium-sized enterprise) sector brings valuable insights into the challenges faced by smaller companies. This collaboration helps ensure that HELIOZ remains responsive to the needs of all types of clients, including those from the KMU sector. Overall, the expected outcomes of these collaborations include increased market reach, expanded networking opportunities, enhanced capacity for identifying and addressing social issues, and improved support for small and medium-sized enterprises within the region.

Partner für das Team sowie zum Identifizieren und Einbringen neuer Themen Ich vertrete im Board den Bereich KMU HELIOZ Du bist aus Vorarlberg und hast unter anderem Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen in Wien studiert Wie war dein weiterer Werdegang Martin Wesian Ich habe durch Auslandsaufenthalte recht spät begonnen zu studieren weshalb meine Master-Arbeit über WADI und Social Entrepreneurship recht rasch zur Gründung von HELIOZ führte Davor war ich ca 10 Jahre im Bereich Kunst- und Kulturmanagement tätig wo gleich wie bei HELIOZ oft Wahrnehmung und Erkenntnis von gesellschaftlichen Themen im Mittelpunkt standen HELIOZ Nach deiner Cholera-Erkrankung erfandest du das WADI War dir damals schon bewusst dass dies ein so großer Auftakt für deine berufliche Weiterentwicklung wird Martin Wesian Eigentlich wollte ich das WADI neben meiner vorherigen Tätigkeit im Rahmen einer humanitär tätigen NGO umsetzen Es war jedoch schnell klar dass zur Umsetzung solch eines Projektes ein ambitioniertes Team ein
